Bashundhara Kings Ultras (BKU) (), is a fan club supporting the Bashundhara Kings, a Bangladeshi football club. Established on April 29, 2021, it was the first registered fan club in Bangladesh, and it is one of the largest fan clubs in the country. The fan club has been allocated the North Gallery at matches, where they are positioned as the Mid-ground Ultra supporters.
The organization manages its members through various social media platforms, including Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, WhatsApp, and Telegram. Actively operates on Bangladesh football and the Bashundhara Kings, and has boosted attendance in the gallery. The Bashundhara Kings Ultras were known the use of colorful smoke and pyro effects in the stands of Bangladeshi football, contributing to its fan culture and visual spectacle.
History
On April 29, 2021, MD Saruare Alam Khan created the Facebook page Bashundhara Kings Ultras to promote support for the club and to encourage wider interest in football within Bangladesh’s domestic league. The group, managed by co-founders Omayes Sarkar and Mahmudul Rifat, gradually expanded through Facebook and Messenger. On February 1, 2022, Bashundhara Kings Ultras was officially recognized as an 'Official Fan Club' through a certificate signed by Bashundhara Kings President Md. Imrul Hasan. The Ultras made their first official gallery debut on February 17, 2022. Following their recognition, the group began organizing membership drives nationwide by establishing regional zones. As of now, the organization reports more than 500 members and volunteers.[citation needed]
Innovations and Influence
Bashundhara Kings Ultras have organized events intended to engage younger supporters in the gallery. In mid-2022, they started flying colored smoke in the gallery, later adding fireworks, vuvuzelas, and drums. On 7 November 2023, some members of the Mohun Bagan supporters group, "Mariners Basecamp – Ultras Mohun Bagan," came to watch their away match (Bashundhara Kings' Home Match) held at Bashundhara Kings Arena. Bashundhara Kings Ultras welcomed them, exchanging greetings and gifts. One of BKU’s most significant displays came on 14 July 2023 during a match against Dhaka Abahani, when they unveiled a 1,200-square-foot tifo bearing their logo—the largest tifo in Bangladesh football to date. Beyond this, the Ultras also have their own underground futsal teams in the cities of Dhaka, Mymensingh, and Gopalganj. They have participated in several futsal tournaments so far.
Smoke bomb controversy
Bashundhara Kings played their final match of the first season of the Bangladesh Challenge Cup against Mohammedan SC. In the 62nd minute, some members of the Bashundhara Kings Ultras threw four smoke bombs onto the field, in protest at the referee not giving a penalty. As a result of the smoke bombs, the match was stopped for more than 10 minutes. After play resumed, Bashundhara Kings won the match 3–1. Mohammedan coach Alfaz Ahmed felt that the actions of the Bashundhara Kings Ultras had helped the Bashundhara Kings to win the game.
